item.title: PROC-9177223: NGN Chickpea time of sowing for disease control in Southern Queensland
item.description: Chickpeas are an important part of winter crop rotations in Queensland; however, disease can be a major limitation to production. Ascochyta blight is a major disease of chickpea, for which current varieties lack resistance to. Fungicides are the primary method of controlling Ascochyta blight, often requiring multiple applications when conditions are conductive. The high cost of these applications and potential for the development of fungicide resistance means alternative control methods are needed. Using an integrated disease management strategy can improve disease control and limit the risks of developing resistance. Optimising the time of sowing can be an effective method to manage Ascochyta blight as later plantings can help to avoid disease impacts through limiting the number of rain events.

item.title: PROC-9177215: NGN Faba bean variety and agronomy trials in Tasmania
item.description: The NGN faba bean variety and agronomy trials in Tasmania aim to address the current limitations in faba bean production within the region. Despite the high cost of importing new varieties and the limited adoption of faba beans due to lower returns compared to other field crops, there is a renewed interest in this legume rotation crop. This resurgence is driven by the development of local market opportunities.

item.title: Proc-9177221: NGN Summer weeds fleabane and sowthistle management demonstrations for the Victorian Mallee
item.description: Fleabane and sowthistle are challenging summer weeds affecting Victorian Mallee growers, with prolific seed production and resistance to multiple herbicides. At NGN forums, growers identified these weeds as a primary constraint due to the high cost of effective chemical control. GRDC has invested in research and tools like the 'Integrated Weed Management Manual' and 'Summer Weed Tool' to guide the management of these weeds. This investment will validate and demonstrate management strategies in trials over two years to reduce fleabane and sowthistle populations using current chemical and cultural control options. Victorian Mallee growers will be provided with peer-to-peer learning opportunities via extension activities to further refine and effectively implement these strategies.

item.title: DRH/2425/001/Brief: Pre-RFT industry briefing - DEFENCE HOME OWNERSHIP ASSISTANCE SCHEME – HOME LOAN PROVIDER PANEL
item.description:
The Commonwealth of Australia, represented by the Department of Defence (Commonwealth) is seeking to engage a panel of home loan providers for the Defence Home Ownership Assistance Scheme or DHOAS.

The Defence Home Ownership Assistance Scheme (DHOAS) assists current and former Australian Defence Force (ADF) members and their families to achieve home ownership. DHOAS is administered by the Department of Veterans' Affairs on behalf of the Department of Defence.

The Scheme provides eligible Australian Defence Force (ADF) members with subsidy assistance on the interest expense incurred on a home loan, which is only available through panel providers.

The DHOAS is an integral part of the Australian Government’s initiative to increase ADF recruitment and retention. By joining the panel, home loan providers will have the opportunity to offer their service to a significant and valuable customer base, while contributing to the wellbeing and financial stability of ADF members and their families.

It is anticipated that there will be an initial term with options for extension based on performance.

The Commonwealth anticipates that a formal Request for Tender, through an open approach to market will be released in Q1 FY 25/26.

item.title: PROC-9177165: NGN - Making sorghum reliable for Central NSW
item.description: Sorghum is a popular choice in the feedlot industries, especially for pork and poultry. However, transporting grain outside the local region is often not economical for intensive animal facilities. This presents a great opportunity for growers in Central NSW to diversify their cropping enterprises and meet local demand. There are potential markets in boxing (Bathurst or Dubbo), two large pet food manufacturers in Bathurst / Blaney, and an emerging demand for feedlot sorghum.

item.title: CSIRORFT2025012: Hot Water Plant Electrification – CSIRO Newcastle (Construct only)
item.description:
CSIRO requires an experienced and qualified Mechanical Services Contractor to manage, construct and deliver the electrification of the gas fired primary- and secondary heat source at CSIRO’s Newcastle premises as per the design developed by CSIRO. This design:

(a) uses the two existing lead-lag reversible chillers in heat-pump mode for low-temperature heating-hot-water production, with one new water-to-water heat-pump/s installed in an existing plant room to boost the low-temperature heating hot water (HHW) to a higher temperature to meet existing field terminal device requirements. 

(b) Decouples the domestic hot water (DHW) system from the HHW system to a standalone central potable DHW system. The non-potable DHW system will be decommissioned and replaced with instantaneous hot water units at nominated locations.

item.title: ATM_2024_3394: Methodology guidance for estimating and reporting of greenhouse gas emissions from Australian agricultural enterprises
item.description: This ATM is for the provision of detailed methodology guidance for the estimation and reporting of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from Australian agricultural enterprises (excluding Land Use, Land Use Change and Forestry source and sinks). The methodology guidance will support Australian farmers, agricultural advisors and GHG calculator and accounting tool developers to consistently estimate and report emissions.

This includes the infrastructure to connect the site to the main electrical distribution network, as well as the construction and connection of electrical circuits within the AWS sites.

item.title: CSIRORFT2025015: Boolardy Homestead Airstrip upgrade project, Murchison WA – Head Contractor Services
item.description:
CSIRO through this RFT is seeking responses from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of Head Contractor (Contractor) construction services for the delivery of the Boolardy Homestead airstrip upgrade project located at Inyarrimanha Ilgari Bundara, the CSIRO Murchison Radio-astronomy Observatory (the Observatory), Beringarra Pindar Road, Murchison WA 6603.

The scope of the project includes, but is not limited to the following:

(a) Heritage protection as required

(b) Clearing and grubbing activities for the project

(c) Cut/fill enabling earthworks including erosion, sediment and stormwater control

(d) Extension of current airstrip pavement to 1500m in length and 23m in width

(e) Re-grade and seal of airstrip with tie-in cross-strip (runway2)

(f) New sealed taxi-way and parking apron

(g) Marking of sealed airstrip, taxi-way and parking apron

(h) Amend and match existing fencing

(i) Floodlighting

(j) Relocation of departure lounge (a demountable) and an existing Illuminated Wind Direction Indicator

(k) Potential (cost dependant) new fencing, vehicle and pedestrian gates.

item.title: Health/E24-586250: TRAINING & SUPPORT: NATIONAL ABORIGINAL AND TORRES STRAIT ISLANDER FLEXIBLE AGED CARE SERVICES MOVE TO NEW AGED CARE ACT
item.description:
The Department of Health and Aged Care requires the services of an organisation to provide services to develop and deliver targeted training and assistance to National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Flexible Aged Care Service (NATSIFAC) Providers to support the transition to the new Aged Care Act. The intent of this project is to support NATSIFAC Service Providers to:

  • Understand how the new Act and Rules will apply to the delivery of NATSIFAC services;
  • Implement and embed the regulatory changes (administrative, reporting and legislative) into their systems, policies and practices;
  • Support their staff to understand the new requirements;
  • Support care recipients and their families, carers and representatives to understand what changes mean for them; and
  • Ensure all training and training materials developed are culturally safe.

item.title: 50827: Seeker Design Study and Industrialisation
item.description:
The Guided Weapons and Explosive Ordnance (GWEO) Seeker Technology Development Program (TDP) aims to collaborate with Lead Industry Partner(s) and a network of Australian small and medium enterprises (SMEs), working alongside DSTG. Together, they will design, develop, and produce a prototype for an operationally effective seeker for future GWEO systems, with an initial focus on developing seeker subsystem for Low-Cost Loitering Munitions (LCLM) under the LCLM Seeker TDP. The Commonwealth plans to commence a Seeker Design Study in Q3 2025 as the first phase of this program.

The Seeker Design Study may award up to two contracts to develop a detailed proposal for the conceptual design and development plan for a Low Cost Loitering Munition Seeker subsystem. The design study results will be used by Defence to develop a work package for the Seeker Prototype Development under the LCLM Seeker TDP. The Commonwealth intends to invite the Seeker Design Study participants to take part in a Request for Tender. The tender responses will be assessed against an evaluation criteria, with one entity being awarded a longer-term contract focused on Seeker Prototype Development under the LCLM Seeker TDP.

item.title: P24/461: Provision of Security Risk Assessment Services
item.description:
The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission (ACIC) is approaching the market to engage a security consultant to undertake an Agency Security Plan. The Agency Security Plan will consist of an:

  • Agency Security Risk Assessment
  • Agency Security Risk Action Plan
  • Security Policy Remediation Project

The Commonwealth Protective Policy Framework (PSPF) mandates that all Commonwealth entities develop a protective security plan to articulate how security risks will be managed and how security aligns with the Agency’s priorities and objectives. Under the PSPF, agency security plans must be reviewed at least every two years. A security plan is a 'living' document and requires review and adjustment to ensure the goals and management of security risks keeps pace with changes in the entity and with emerging threats.

item.title: HOMEAFFAIRS/2183/RFT: Provision of an internet gateway security system
item.description: The Department is seeking to modernise and futureproof its perimeter security services with the adoption of Secure Service Edge (SSE).  As part of this we are looking for a contemporary and effective secure web gateway service (also referred to as proxy). The Department is seeking a new secure web gateway solution that will need to be resilient, robust, and focused on ensuring minimal impact on the Department’s 24 hour, 365 day business needs.

item.title: PROC-9177224: GRDC International Visiting Fellowships Program 2025/2026
item.description:
GRDC has identified access to capacity in new/emerging research disciplines or access to capacity in scientific disciplines that have not historically been applied to Agricultural research as one mechanism through which to address perennial research problems and create greater value for grain growers. Further, it has recognised that the current and future research landscape requires fostering collaborative international engagement by providing enabling support to accelerate the delivery of research outputs in GRDC’s 2023-2028 RDE Strategic Plan through International Network-to-Network Collaborations involving multidisciplinary, complementary, and cross-cultural teams.

 

This investment seeks to partner emerging national and international research leaders from existing, new and/or traditionally non-grains focussed research disciplines with established Australian grains industry researchers to tackle intractable problems in GRDC’s strategic priority investment areas. The proposed investment program presents a broad open-call mechanism to drive further Australian grains industry access to new research capacity in GRDC’s strategic priority areas.

 

IVFP goals include:

 

1) Support for building research capacity towards activities that launch international research network of networks (NoN) that will catalyse collaboration that results in an accelerated advancement of solution to R&D challenges after the award period and

 

2) Foster a diverse and internationally competent Australian-based workforce trained in conducting and leading multiteam international collaboration that can be harnessed to address industry challenges targeted at the GRDC’s 2023-28 RD&E Strategic Plan to deliver benefit to Australian growers.

 

The Proposal MUST be submitted by the Host Institution in Australia and not by the international visitor.

 

GRDC will award a maximum of 9 International Visiting Fellowships for the 2025-2026 financial year.

item.title: MGF_17: Supply of Medical Grade Footwear to eligible persons
item.description:
NOTE: existing suppliers need not reapply

The Medical Grade Footwear (MGF) Programme is an important part of DVA’s health care arrangements and is part of the Rehabilitation Appliance Programme (RAP).  The MGF Programme provides a nation-wide access to a wide range of MGF and related services for entitled persons.

item.title: DPC-2017: Invitation to provide Day Procedure Centre Services to the Veteran Community
item.description: The Department of Veterans’ Affairs (DVA) is seeking to contract with eligible stand-alone private day hospitals (referred to as Day Procedure Centres or DPCs) to provide DPC services for DVA Entitled Persons across Australia from 1 October 2017 onwards.

item.title: PHS-16: Private Hospital Services
item.description: DVA is seeking the provision of Private Hospital services for Entitled Persons by publishing this Invitation to Provide Private Hospital Services to the Veteran Community.

item.title: CNS16: Department of Veterans' Affairs Community Nursing Services Invitation
item.description: Department of Veterans' Affairs invites interested suppliers of Community Nursing Services to apply to provide these services from 1 July 2016.
